body.p:
I have to acknowledge
yours of 29th ultimo and to thank
you for acceding to my request
respecting my little work,
which will ? be published
here on 1st July, and I will
endeavor to sent you 1 doz
copies as near that? time as
possible. I concluded from
your note ? it that
you are agreeable to the
terms I proposed, 25 pc commission.
I think my book must be
rebound cheap even in the
American sense of the word,
as each part will comprise

about 180 pages of matter, with the
best paper and type for 2/?
a part. It? will I hope be concluded in October
I have a first rate list of
subscribers all the heads of
the nation Dr Adler Sir Moses
Montefiore? the Rothschild's
? and Dr Berusch
has introduced it very favorably
to public notice in the Hebrew
Observer. I shall be obliged
by your putting in the follow
ing advertizement in the
Occident for July, and I should
wish it continued till October
when you will please alter
it to announce the second
part; though I will write
previously in case any thing
should prevent its publication
at that time.

“To be published in two parts
price 2/. each part.

Now ready Post? ?
Sabbath Evenings at Home
or
? Conversations on the
Jewish Religion its Spirit
and Observances by

Mi? Mendes Belesario
Published in London by Mes Joel
42 South Cripplegate. To be had
in New York of Mr Daniel Wolff
32 South St. Philadelphia Revd
Isaac Leeser &

You will please put this in
proper order for me.
and now having concluded
my business arrangements,
permit me Dr Sir to express my
sincere regret for the severe?
loss you have sustained by
the fire, for which I trust
you may meet with compen
sation by an increased sale
of your books, in which business ?

it will not be in my power to
assist you, at least as regards the
Prayer Books; for of course our
? consisted? Mr De Sola's
are in general circulation among
our congregation. I understand
you contemplate reprinting his
in America, and that your
dependence lies there, for I
think it right to ? that
you are not likely to meet
with much support here. You
have ? been misinformed
as to Mr Genese's influence
he could do nothing whatever
I regret much to find that
you have still so many powerful
things to contend with, but
think you are mistaken in
your impression of Mr Morais
unless he be greatly altered, for
I knew him intimately, very
deep knowledge of Hebrew is
derived from him, and I

should have thought he would
rather have songlets? to heal than
forment? discord However as one
who has so warmly ?
the blessings of brotherly union
I trust you will still find young?
the respected ? of your old
friendly circle and that you
will remember by conceding
a little you will be conferring
a real blessing on your opponents
as well as the Israelites generally
by ? them again to
profit by your servant teaching
and piety Believe me that
I have and shall ever promote
the circulation of your books
to the utmost of my power
with the exception of the Prayer
Books which I could not do
conscientiously without acting

unhandsomely by Mr De Sola or
you will acknowledge that
often the toil and expense
they have cost him it would
be unfair for one of his
own flock to help another
to keep the benefit. My cousins
the Misses Belisario have kindly
taken a large supply of your
Catechisms I believe 30—6 reading
books—a number of Peixotto—
1 large Bible and 3 copies of
sermons for their Establishment
